awd_abstract_narration: This project deals with radiation enhanced sintering of ceramics.  The          approach is to neutron irradiate the ceramic powders to increase the            defect concentration which in turn would lead to radiation enhanced             diffusion (RED).  Experiments will be conducted on the as received and          irradiated AlN and Al2O3 to measure radiation enhanced sintering (RES)          from shrinkage rates and microstructural observations, and to study the         underlying basic phenomenon of RED using the radiotracer sectioning             technique.  The results will be analyzed to identify the parameters             more critical to RED and RES.                                                   Sintering is the critical step in the processing of ceramic materials.          The strength and toughness of ceramics depend on this.  The Principal           Investigator proposes a novel method of improving the sintering of pure         covalent ceramics (e.g., nitrides and carbides).
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
